key_insight: Language models can be trained to make open-ended, probabilistic forecasts at scale by synthesizing forecasting questions from daily news and training on that curated dataset while preventing temporal leakage during training and evaluation.
problem_solved: Provides a scalable, curated pipeline and dataset for open-ended forecasting, addressing the lack of large training corpora and the risk of future-information leakage in evaluation.
method: Automatically synthesize novel forecasting questions from global news to build the OpenForesight dataset.
Train Qwen3 'thinking' models on the synthesized forecasting tasks to improve open-ended prediction capability.
Enforce strict temporal safeguards (offline news snapshots / time-based partitioning) to avoid leaking future information into training and evaluation.
impact: Enables practitioners to develop and reliably evaluate models for decision-making under uncertainty by supplying a scalable dataset and best practices to avoid temporal leakage, improving trustworthiness of forecasted outputs.
visual_elements: Pipeline diagram: news feed → question synthesis → OpenForesight dataset → Qwen3 training → evaluation
Timeline graphic showing temporal partitioning/offline snapshot to illustrate anti-leakage safeguards
Sample QA card: example forecasting question with model prediction and confidence interval
Bar or area chart comparing dataset scale (OpenForesight) vs typical manually curated forecasting datasets
paper_title: Scaling Open-Ended Reasoning to Predict the Future
paper_authors: Nikhil Chandak, Shashwat Goel, Ameya Prabhu, Moritz Hardt, Jonas Geiping
